word:
413. Dry food that requires mastication is far preferable to porridges. The health food preparations are a blessing in this respect. . . . For those who can use them, good vegetables, prepared in a 
                                                                           91
healthful manner, are better than soft mushes and porridge. Fruits, used with thoroughly cooked bread two or three days old, which is more healthful than fresh bread, slowly and thoroughly masticated, will furnish all that the system requires.-- U. T., Jan. 11, 1897.
